item.title: Starboard 提名四名董事进入 Kenvue 董事会
item.description: 周三的一份监管文件显示，对冲基金 Starboard Value 已提名包括其首席投资官在内的四名董事进入消费品公司 Kenvue 董事会。【原文：Hedge fund Starboard Value has nominated four directors, including its chief investment officer, to the board of consumer products company Kenvue , a regulatory filing showed on Wednesday.】

item.title: 纽约时报》预计第一季度订阅收入低于预期
item.description: 纽约时报》周三预测第一季度订阅收入增长低于华尔街预期，表明吸引新订户的竞争日益激烈。【原文：The New York Times forecast first-quarter subscription revenue growth below Wall Street estimates on Wednesday, signaling growing competition to attract new subscribers.】

item.title: 更加拥挤的美元交易增加了对欧元平价的预期：路透社民意调查
item.description: 路透社调查显示，近三分之一的货币策略师目前预计欧元将跌至与美元平价或以下，而上个月仅有五分之一的策略师预计欧元将跌至与美元平价或以下。【原文：A crowded strong U.S. dollar trade is set to get more bunched up in coming months, with near one-third of currency strategists polled by Reuters now expecting the euro to fall to parity with the dollar or below versus only one-fifth last month.】

item.title: 独家新闻消息人士称，尽管有豁免，美国仍停止为外国援助采购食品
item.description: 据九位消息人士透露，自特朗普政府开始全面审查联邦援助支出以来，美国已经停止了外国粮食援助项目的采购，尽管近两周前美国曾为粮食援助项目签发了豁免令。【原文：The U.S. has stopped purchases for foreign food aid programs since the Trump administration began a sweeping review of federal aid spending, despite a waiver issued nearly two weeks ago for food assistance, according to nine sources.】

item.title: 消费疲软，哈雷戴维森预计 2025 年摩托车收入疲软
item.description: 哈雷戴维森（Harley-Davidson）周三表示，由于消费者不再购买大件商品，该公司预计 2025 年摩托车收入将持平或下降 5%，导致其股价在盘前交易中下跌约 3.5%。【原文：Harley-Davidson said on Wednesday it expects 2025 motorcycle revenue to be flat to down 5%, as consumers pulled back from big-ticket purchases, sending its shares down about 3.5% in premarket trade.】

item.title: 优步（Uber）假日季打车和外卖需求强劲，营收超预期
item.description: 优步科技公司（Uber Technologies）周三公布的第四季度营收超出市场预期，原因是越来越多的人使用该打车平台上下班，而且该公司的外卖业务也受益于假日季的强劲需求。【原文：Uber Technologies surpassed market expectations for fourth-quarter revenue on Wednesday, as more people used the ride-hailing platform for office commutes and its delivery business benefited from strong holiday-season demand.】

item.title: 卡普里预测年度收入低于预期
item.description: 卡普里控股公司（Capri Holdings）周三预测的年度收入低于预期，因为该公司的所有者迈克尔-考尔斯（Michael Kors）正努力应对奢侈品需求放缓以及美洲和亚洲市场持续下滑的问题。【原文：Capri Holdings forecast annual revenue below estimates on Wednesday, as the Michael Kors owner grappled with slowing demand for luxury goods and persistent declines in the Americas and Asia.】

item.title: 华特迪士尼在《莫阿娜 2》的帮助下实现盈利目标
item.description: 华特迪士尼周三的业绩大幅超出华尔街的季度盈利预期，动画续集《莫阿娜 2》的假日票房表现强劲，以及该公司流媒体业务的利润增加，都对业绩产生了推动作用。【原文：Walt Disney sharply outperformed Wall Street's quarterly earnings estimates on Wednesday, with results buoyed by the strong holiday box office performance of animated sequel "Moana 2" and higher profits at the company's streaming business.】

item.title: 巴西桑坦德银行第四季度净利润增长 75
item.description: 西班牙桑坦德银行（Banco Santander）的子公司桑坦德巴西公司（Santander Brasil）周三报告称，由于利差扩大和费用增加，该公司第四季度净利润增长了 75%，超过了市场预期。【原文：Santander Brasil a subsidiary of Spain's Banco Santander , reported on Wednesday a 75% jump in its fourth-quarter net profit, surpassing market expectations on the back of better spreads and increased fees.】

item.title: 巴西航空工业公司与 Flexjet 签订价值高达 70 亿美元的行政专机协议
item.description: 巴西飞机制造商巴西航空工业公司（Embraer）周三表示，该公司已与 Flexjet 公司签署了一份价值高达 70 亿美元的购买协议，将购买 Phenom 和 Praetor 公务喷气机机队，其中包括 182 架飞机的确定订单和另外 30 架飞机的选择权。【原文：Brazilian planemaker Embraer said on Wednesday it has signed a purchase deal worth up to $7 billion with Flexjet for a fleet of Phenom and Praetor executive jets, including firm orders for 182 aircraft and options for another 30.】

item.title: Workday 将裁员 8.5%
item.description: 薪酬处理公司Workday周三表示，由于要应对竞争和不确定的支出环境，该公司将裁员约1750人，占现有员工总数的8.5%。【原文：Payroll processing company Workday said on Wednesday it will cut around 1,750 jobs, or 8.5% of its current workforce, as it grapples with competition and an uncertain spending environment.】

item.title: 早间竞价：字母表失灵、日元飙升、中国回归
item.description: Mike Dolan 展望美国和全球市场的未来一天【原文：A look at the day ahead in U.S. and global markets from Mike Dolan】

item.title: 独家：印度将重新审查豪华汽车和太阳能电池的关税附加，可能刺激美国进口
item.description: 印度财政部一位高级官员表示，印度计划对包括豪华汽车、太阳能电池和化学品在内的30多种商品的进口关税进行审查，随着全球贸易紧张局势的加剧，这可能会导致从美国进口的商品增加。【原文：India plans to review import tariffs on over 30 items, including luxury cars, solar cells and chemicals, a senior finance ministry official said, potentially leading to increased imports from the United States as global trade tensions grow.】

item.title: 邦吉公司第四季度利润不及预期
item.description: 邦吉全球公司（Bunge Global）周三未能达到华尔街对其第四季度利润的预期，此前全球农作物价格过剩打击了这家谷物贸易商的利润率。【原文：Bunge Global missed Wall Street's expectations for fourth-quarter profit on Wednesday, after a global glut in crop prices took a hit on the grain trader's margins.】

item.title: 美国参议院小组深入探讨去库存问题
item.description: 本周三，美国银行及其监管机构将成为热点话题，因为立法者将探讨保守派人士和一些公司关于银行拒绝为特定行业或政治团体提供服务的说法。【原文：U.S. banks and their regulators will be on the hot seat on Wednesday, as lawmakers explore claims from conservatives and some companies that they deny services to particular industries or political groups.】

item.title: 投资者称，礼来需要一项刺激减肥药销售的计划
item.description: 礼来公司（Eli Lilly）的投资者和分析师表示，他们希望了解该公司究竟计划如何增加流行减肥药 Zepbound 在美国的销售，因为上个月该公司预测该药第四季度的收入低于预期。【原文：Eli Lilly investors and analysts said they want to hear details from the company on how exactly it plans to grow U.S. sales of popular weight-loss drug Zepbound after it last month forecast lower-than-expected fourth-quarter revenues for the drug.】

item.title: 赫伯罗特称可应对中美关税
item.description: 集装箱航运公司赫伯罗特首席执行官周二告诉记者，赫伯罗特将有能力应对美国对中国产品征收关税。【原文：Container shipping liner Hapag-Lloyd will be able to cope with the advent of U.S. tariffs on Chinese products, its chief executive told reporters on Tuesday.】

item.title: 诺和诺德称无法避免特朗普可能征收的关税，但已做好充分准备
item.description: Wegovy 制造商诺和诺德公司首席执行官周三表示，美国总统唐纳德-特朗普威胁要对欧盟征收关税，诺和诺德公司也不能幸免，但该公司相信其业务已做好充分准备。【原文：Wegovy maker Novo Nordisk is not immune to tariffs U.S. President Donald Trump is threatening to levy on the European Union, its chief executive said on Wednesday, but it is confident its business is well-positioned.】

item.title: 纳斯达克期货表现落后，Alphabet 和 AMD 因业绩预测黯淡而下滑
item.description: 美国股指期货周三下跌，纳斯达克指数受到的影响尤为严重，因为 Alphabet 和 AMD 的股价在低迷的预测之后下跌，而其他行业的负面盈利反应加剧了损失。【原文：U.S. stock index futures dipped on Wednesday, with the Nasdaq particularly impacted as shares of Alphabet and AMD fell following subdued forecasts, while negative earnings reactions in other sectors compounded losses.】

item.title: 米其林认为特朗普关税可能影响采购和投资
item.description: 法国轮胎制造商米其林公司周三表示，该公司正在评估美国可能对加拿大和墨西哥征收关税的影响，但现在估计征税对其供应链和投资的影响还为时过早。【原文：Michelin is assessing the impact from possible U.S. tariffs on Canada and Mexico but it is too early to estimate consequences from the levies on its supply chain and investments, the French tyre maker said on Wednesday.】

item.title: 无论是否发生贸易战，全球投资者对中国的态度都会变得更加谨慎
item.description: 随着中国和美国就关税问题展开争论，世界上最大的两个经济体之间可能达成协议，也可能爆发贸易战，远离中国股市正成为外国投资者的默认选择。【原文：As China and the U.S. battle over tariffs, locked in a tussle that could result in a deal or a trade war between the world's two largest economies, staying away from China's stock market is becoming the default option for foreign investors.】

item.title: 在关税不确定的情况下，摩根士丹利下调美联储降息预期
item.description: 摩根士丹利与巴克莱（Barclays）和麦格理（Macquarie）一样，预测美国联邦储备委员会今年将单次降息 25 个基点，理由是唐纳德-特朗普总统的关税政策带来了不确定性。【原文：Morgan Stanley joined Barclays and Macquarie in forecasting a single 25 basis point interest rate cut by the U.S. Federal Reserve this year, citing uncertainty from President Donald Trump's tariff policy.】

item.title: 俄罗斯寻求终止外国企业对伏特加生产商俄罗斯标准公司的控股
item.description: 俄罗斯财政部周三表示，已将俄罗斯标准集团公司列入 "重要经济组织 "名单，并就其外国公司控股结构提起仲裁。【原文：Russia's finance ministry has added the Russian Standard Group companies to a list of "economically significant organisations" and launched an arbitration case over their foreign corporate holding structure, it said on Wednesday.】

item.title: 消息人士称，OpenAI 的 Altman 将在阿布扎比停留，参加 MGX 筹资谈判
item.description: 两位知情人士透露，OpenAI 首席执行官山姆-阿尔特曼（Sam Altman）计划本周访问阿拉伯联合酋长国，与阿布扎比投资集团 MGX 讨论融资事宜。【原文：OpenAI CEO Sam Altman plans to visit the United Arab Emirates this week to discuss raising funds with Abu Dhabi investment group MGX, two sources with knowledge of the matter said.】

item.title: 独家：印度指控起亚在类似大众的争端中逃税 1.55 亿美元
item.description: 据一份文件和两位消息人士称，印度指控韩国起亚汽车公司通过对进口零部件进行错误分类而逃税 1.55 亿美元，但该汽车制造商否认有不当行为，这是一家外国汽车制造商与新德里就关税问题进行的最新斗争。【原文：India has accused South Korea's Kia of evading taxes of $155 million by misclassifying component imports but the carmaker has denied wrongdoing, the latest fight by a foreign automaker with New Delhi over tariffs, according to a document and two sources.】

item.title: 道达尔能源公司首席执行官称欧洲应与美国就液化天然气自由贸易进行谈判
item.description: 道达尔能源公司（TotalEnergies）首席执行官帕特里克-普瓦尼（Patrick Pouyanne）周三表示，欧洲国家应通过谈判从美国获得液化天然气（LNG）自由贸易保障。【原文：TotalEnergies CEO Patrick Pouyanne said on Wednesday that European countries should negotiate to obtain a free trade guarantee on liquefied natural gas (LNG) from the United States.】

item.title: 彭博新闻社报道：中国正酝酿调查苹果应用商店的收费标准和做法
item.description: 彭博新闻社周三援引知情人士的话报道称，中国反垄断监管机构正准备对苹果公司的政策和应用程序商店收费进行调查。【原文：China's antitrust regulator is preparing for a possible investigation into Apple's policies and app store fees, Bloomberg News reported on Wednesday, citing people familiar with the matter.】

item.title: 官员称，如果可再生能源发展缓慢，日本对液化天然气的需求可能会增加；加拿大将提供相关服务
item.description: 日本工业部的一位高级官员表示，在可再生能源推广速度低于预期的政府设想方案下，到2040年，日本对液化天然气（LNG）的需求可能会增长10%以上，达到约7400万吨。【原文：Japan's demand for liquefied natural gas (LNG) may grow by more than 10% to some 74 million metric tons by 2040 under a government scenario where the renewable energy rollout goes slower than expected, a senior industry ministry official said.】

item.title: Calastone称，投资者从股票中撤出现金，英国基金遭受重创
item.description: 基金网络 Calastone 周三表示，1 月份英国投资者从股票基金中净撤资 6.4 亿英镑（7.99 亿美元），结束了长期资金流入的势头，英国股票基金的月度净撤资额创下历史第六大纪录。【原文：British investors yanked a net 640 million pounds ($799 million) from equity funds in January, ending a long run of inflows, as UK-focused funds suffered their sixth-biggest monthly net withdrawals on record, funds network Calastone said on Wednesday.】

item.title: 中国外交部敦促中美在进口关税生效之际开展对话
item.description: 在美国对所有中国产品额外征收 10%关税之际，中国外交部周三呼吁中美两国进行对话和磋商。【原文：The Chinese foreign ministry called on Wednesday for dialogue and consultation between China and the United States as an additional 10% in U.S. tariffs on all Chinese products kicked in.】
